review: Cosentyx (secukinumab):15 years my psoriasis has been so bad in my hand, I had fear of loosing it.  At times it would smell of infection due to the layers of buildup.  Painful and unable to use much of the time.  I wore a glove due to unsightlyness.  I began with weekly injections x 4 wks and now injections monthly of Cosentyx. I'm in my 8th week of treatment.  The benefit has greatly exceeded my wildest expectations.  I can see actual skin on my hand first time in over 5 years.  Pain I have suffered for 15 years is gone.  First time in 5 years I can leave the house without a glove.  No side effects noted.  I feel I owe my hand to this company which pays most of my treatment cost.  From my company representative to my speciality pharmacy, everyone involved keeps check on me to see I'm on the right track.  I cannot thank you enough for giving me my hand back after 15 painful, embarrassing years.  I would not have believed had I not experienced it.  Injections are packaged to be ease of use.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I used Cosentix for 2 years and started seeing good improvement on my psoriasis after the first 6 weeks but unfortunately didn't clear up my psoriasis 100%. In the lapse of the 2 years, I had  psoriasis that never went away on my hands (up side) elbows, a big plaque on my back that remains there until today and a few here and there. After the 2 years of use of Cosentyx Express Script totally denied the approval for another year and Cosentyx lab approved free of charge for 2 years but I got it only for a few months close to the end of last year. Then they asked for another doctor's request after I was approved for 2 years. For the meantime of approval my psoriasis went mad and I am still dealing with it and trying to get the best treatment this time but I am not going to continue with Cosentyx this time. Cosentyx it works, but for me it didn't work as expected.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I used Cosentyx for 6 months, I was hopeful at the start as I noticed a slight improvement after a couple of weeks, it got a little better after a couple of months then started slowly coming back, it also gave me a nasty rash that was an absolute nightmare, I could not stop itching, it was that bad I honestly thought I had scabies, I went to the Doctor who said I was having an allergic reaction so prescribed me anti histamines which I am still taking 3 to 4 a day, depending how bad the itching gets, I saw my dermatologist again this week and I am now going to try Taltz, so I live in hope this one might actually work. I tried methotrexate and etanercept prior to cosentyx, they proved equally as useless for me
Cosentyx (secukinumab):Terrible drug - after 5 weeks psoriasis worse than ever.
Cosentyx (secukinumab):I just wanted to thank the makers of Cosentyx for their help.I get my first dose this week and I am so excited.Thank you so much!

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I have been on cosentyx for 6 years and it has been a life changer. Before starting cosentyx I tried everything for my psoriasis and joint pain nothing worked till my doctor told me about cosentyx. I was one of her first patients to be put on cosentyx and have been using it ever since awesome medication.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):Started Cosentyx  a year ago for 90% covered plaque psoriasis  and psoriasis arthritis.  Literally gave me my life back joint pain gone skin cleared up .Just received my artificial  hip back on Cosentyx again this drug gave me a life worth living again thanks Coaenryx

Cosentyx (secukinumab):Cosentyx does not work with me. I’d be better off injecting saline solution. My psoriasis has more than tripled in coverage area. I was on Taltz before and within three days of the first injection I could tell a huge difference. But when covid came they couldn’t ship it to me in time and my psoriasis came back with a double punch. I have an appt with my doctor today. Hopefully he can help me out. I look like a leper.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I was diagnosed  with both psoriasis and eczema, so the put me on cosentyx.  So far I have had 5 injections but not much change  yet and now I am getting new spots. I go to the dermatologist in a couple  of days so I don't know what she will do next.  I have had stomach  upset after taking injection my nose runs like a faucet on and off. So we will see. I'm not sure what to think of this drug.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I've had psoriasis for 50 years and have had several treatments including Humira, methotrexate, and many others.  I was on Humira for 3 years and it help a little.  My doctor suggested I try cosentyx and after the first dose (300 mg) my psoriasis cleared up by 70%!  Unbelieveable!  It's been 4 weeks now and it's 95% clear!  So far, no side effects!

Cosentyx (secukinumab):Was on Humira for psoriasis plaques on elbows knuckles knees .That was first biologic and was wonderful tho never quite cleared it up.Also I take high doses of adderall and despite adding humira I never had abnormal blood tests. Super annoyed when corona started as apparently my doc office is getting paid off by novartis(cosentyx) bc they called me telling me to switch to cosentyx and stop humira. Pain in the butt but did it. Was going in the following week for my appointment and strangely the doc asked ME why switching? Uh I said you called ME and told me that the tumor suppressant is less broad in cosentyx than humira and I needed to change or take nothing because of covid.He was like hmmm thats interesting as if I'm telling him something when thats what HE was telling me via them calling me.Weird but blew it off

Cosentyx (secukinumab):So, I previously left a review for Stelara - which I had stopped and then had a full blown inflammatory response in my body-joints, tendons, spine, and scalp psoriasis. I since started Cosentyx. I have done the five loading doses (300mg - 2 injections) and I honestly feel 10 x better. I felt so debilitated in the previous state. (I'm in my 30's and very active so debility should not be in my vocab). I still have a little residual arthritis in my hips and tendons but I think it will clear after a while *Fingers Crossed*. It supposed to take anywhere between 12-16 weeks to fully take effect so I have got time to be patient. IF not a little Tylenol and Aleve daily have been working well. I do not feel fatigued as I did with Stelara. I do get a random nasal drip but its manageable compared to the alternative. So I feel like I'm getting back to normal. I probably have to take a biologic for the rest of my life to function normal but if it works, I'm happy. I will up date as time goes on.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I’m now 40 and I just started to have psoriasis at 36. I started Cosentyx in February and it’s now May and the plaques have lightened a lot but haven’t went completely away. My biggest concern is that I’ve been actively working hard to lose weight since November and had lost close to 35lbs when I started Cosentyx. I’ve been on a strict diet since November and exercise program working out 5 to 6 days a week starting January. February I started the starter doses of 2 shots a week for 4 weeks of Cosentyx, I’ve gained the entire amount of weight back mainly in my midsection, regardless of how much I try to lose. I’ve taken the monthly dose now for 2 months and keep gaining. I’ve talked to my dermatologist about it and he just keeps referring to the companies claim it doesn’t cause weight gain. I disagree  because that’s the only thing that’s changed in my regiment. I think I’m going to stop taking. I’d deal with the psoriasis than to keep gaining.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I have mild to moderate psoriasis, mainly on my knees, elbows and lower legs. I started Cosentyx in May of 2019. Within two weeks my psoriasis was clear! BUT I noticed my sinuses were awful and I’ve never had sinus problems before and I just generally felt bad. I decided to stop cosentyx in September of 2019. Since then I’ve had the worst flare up ever in my life. My legs are covered and now my forearms and scalp. I regret getting on cosentyx and honestly wished I would have just stayed in the tanning beds.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):After Humira stopped working for my psoriasis I was switched to cosentyx. Within a month my symptoms had almost completely disappeared. 2 years later my skin is completely clear. It has changed my life. Thank you.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I've had plaque psoriasis for about 5 years now, had it on my scalp as a child and it laid dormant until I turned 30 then BOOM covered in plaques all over. Was prescribed methotrexate originally in low doses which helped but never got me clear. Then slowly my doses had to be increased just to keep me somewhat controlled. I begged my Dr to let me try the newer meds (biologics), he was old school and insisted we stick with the old drugs. I was given a referral to a new dermatologist and thank God for him! Within the first week of my loading doses, my skin began to clear and also feel "normal". Those with psoriasis know how you feel it coming on just under the skin. I'm about to take my 4th loading dose and all that's left is the red areas where my bad plaques were. Every time I shower and exfoliate, they get lighter and fade more and more. The only side effects I've had are feeling slightly jittery directly after my injection and feeling tired. To curb that, I take my shots at bedtime now.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I took Cosentyx for severe psoriasis beginning in February, 2019. I saw good results, with est. 80% plaque clear up in under 4 weeks. However, within the first 6 weeks I developed new onset Crohn's disease. Nobody in my family has a history of IBS. I lost almost half my body weight, suffered severe pain, bleeding, and missed months of work. The doctor doing my colonoscopy couldn't even get a 3rd of the way in without harming me. I'm not alone in this experience  there are other people who have had this experience. Novartis' website still claims that new onset Crohn's or IBS is not possible. I am now on Remicade supported by a high weekly dose of methotrxate, just to avoid having a flare up. I have not had a flare up since stopping Cosentyx. The risk of severe, violent crohns is not worth using this drug.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):Have been on Cosentyx for almost a year and wondering if anyone else may have experienced vision problems after taking this drug? I am 43 years old and had an eye stroke called BRVO in one eye, which is very uncommon for someone my age. I also have a lot of eye twitching. My ALT & AST enzymes have also been elevated while taking Cosentyx. Thank you in advance for your feedback.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):Truly a miracle drug for me. 50 yrs old. Had some plaques but not many. One large one on my right ankle. Got strep throat and it literally took over 90% of my body. Developed left hand joint pain and swelling. Got put straight onto Cosentyx (300 mg/2 pens). Been on it for 9 months now and I am entirely clear with zero side effects. It took a solid 3 months before it was entirely gone. But honestly, this particular biologic has been nothing short of a miracle for me.
Cosentyx (secukinumab):So far so good some minor skin irritation but considering acne and psoriasis most of my life that ain't nothing. We will see long term.....

Cosentyx (secukinumab):This is my 3rd failed biologic. I am at week 12 and not only am I breaking out with new spots but itch is intense. The spots on my hands hurt really bad. I don't think I will be on cosentyx much longer.
Cosentyx (secukinumab):This medication caused me serious bowel complications. My primary care physician took me off the medication immediately. I've been free of bowel issues since that time.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I started Cosentyx after my Dermatologist did a biopsy on 2 spots & it came back psoriasis. She also suspected psoriatic arthritis due to my complaints of joint pain. After expensive lab work to check for TB/hepatitis, I was started on the 5 week starting dose of Cosentyx @ 300mg/week. After week 3-4 I noticed more sinus trouble than normal, developed an acne like rash on both sides of chest, psoriasis developed in ears/lobes, and scalp worsened. It did not do a thing for me & I do regret taking it. I found a new dermatologist who told me to d/c Cosentyx, gave me topicals & wants me to start Humira to treat PA and psoriasis. I’m nervous due to the reaction & lower immunity but told I need to treat PA or joints will worsen. For years of not knowing I had psoriasis, then getting diagnosis & treatment has been life altering. I feel the Cosentyx made things  worse & was not for me.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I started having plaque Psoriasis since I was 15 years old.  Now I am 40 and taking Cosentyx since 5/19. the medication is helping a lot.  I have two spots on my scalp and temple.  The temple area is about 95% clear but my scalp is about 70% clear now.
Cosentyx (secukinumab):Saw results after 2 days took the 5 weekly startup doses and just took my first monthly dose and I'm better than  80 percent better with no side effects.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I used Enbrel for several years before switching to Humira. Like Enbrel, Humira worked great for a number of years until it's effect started to fade a little. My dermatologist suggested that I give Cimzia a try.  After about a month I started to scab up in both ears and both eyes near the tear ducts. I've never had psoriasis in these locations and hoped that it would be temporary and go away. I was prescribed a two other medications to go with the Cosentyx, one for my ears and another for my eyes. Unfortunately after 4 months the ears and eyes have only gotten worse. I've realized that Cosentyx is not for for me.I start Cimzia next week. Really looking forward to looking and feeling normal again.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I just started taking Cosentyx for plaque psoriasis I took my 4 weeks of injection and now on my once a month injection I have cleared up but still not sure what it will do at taking only once a month but this is the trial period but so far so good. Every now and then I still itch some  but nothing like before. No side effects which is great cause everything I tried before I had side effects and had to stop taking I felt so bad all the time nausea was extreme.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):50 year old Trial attorney with an exceptionally stressful job. Second year of law school, developed a few small spots. Lived with it for 20 plus years with only two large patches on both ankles of which I would cover up; one big spot on my left knee. While on vacation, severe case of strep throat. Started Penicillin, cleared my strep throat up and  4 days later, my ENTIRE body flared up. It was horrible. This NEVER happened, ever before and was clearly caused by strep throat. Began first (nothing else) Cosenytx 300 mg. Just finished my 2nd dosage and starting 3rd Tuesday. It has "SLOWLY" helped. Itching is gone. The red patches have definitely reduced in their inflammation. I feel positive but the jury is still out. I will give it more time and see what happens. Fortunately, insurance covered it after much fighting (and photographs of my body). First biologic ever as never needed it before. Some mild edema on both ankles but no "major" side effects as of yet.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):My grandma had it bad. Then at 49 I got it bad. Tried humira, no luck. Now I've been on cosentyx for about 14 months. The thick plaques are gone. Dr did have to up me to 450 mg a month as of last week. It kind of makes my stomach hurt, but I'd rather have a tummy ache than be itching to death. I never knew how tough granny was. This stuff isn't cheap but I was ready to just die. Feel better now.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I've been taking Cosentyx for just shy of a year and my psoriasis has gotten way worse. The itching is something I never had to deal with and it has spread. The sinus troubles are horrible. I've been on so many, I'm not sure if anything is going to help.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):35 years of scalp misery.  Only one month but feel my body changing slowly.  Tried 6 other biologics for 18 months.  Stelara lost most hair.  Orezka depression diarrhea.  Xeljanz nothing.  Tremfya nothing.  Humira nothing.  But now, still have sores on head most painful. Feel a little better. Thanks to this medication

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I have had plaque psoriasis for the last 20 years, over the last 5 years it has gotten progressively worse.  I have failed humira, enbrel and several other biologics.  I have been on Cosentyx for 6 months.  After about 2 months into treatment I experienced about 95 percent clearing. After my 2nd maintenance dose I noticed a few patches reoccurring.  I am now six months into treatment and am experiencing about a 35 percent reappearance of previously clear areas.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):The customer service I experienced trying to obtain the medication through their co-payment assistance program was at best overwhelmingly frustrating!The person that was supposed to be "assisting" with the process kept insisting that I give a non-existent "bin" number from my insurance card.I repeatedly tried to explain that it was not there and the representative  just could not seem to believe me.Without the payment assistance the medication will cost me several hundred dollars a month.I almost decided to go ahead and pay out of pocket but reconsidered when the representative informed me that I had no other choice.This is not the only medication on the market for psoriasis and I refuse to support an organization that indicated they have you over a barrel!

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I just need to tell people if you have  mild Psoriasis, live with it, because if you take strong medication, later you will end up with all body covered with Psoriasis, during my 30years with PsoriasisI had very small spot on my leg & because I wanted it to disappear, I follow all kinds of medication and now I am 90% covered with P, anyway this is my advise to new patient with Mild or little, when it is little, it does not hurt, I know it looks bad, but live with it, it is a monster, when you have too much of it you will wish you didn't startI use to be on Enbrel but it failed after many years, now I had 5 weeks of cosentyx  , first 3 weeks I had so much spots may be 60% of my body because I stopped Enbrel and I had so much pain , and so much skin on my floor after the 4 weeks I feel better, little pain, very little skin shedding but all the spots are not cleared yet, I hope it will be cleared in next month , I let you know  I put 5 stars because I am still starting
Cosentyx (secukinumab):After 5 other costly biologics and 35 years of plaques and swollen joint within 3 days felt better.  A blessing from God

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I am on 4th month of Cosentyx and it may not work for some but as of second month my skin was 90 percent clear. I just have scarring from where the rash was severe on my arms and legs. My two elbows have a pea size scale on it. Because I am getting the meds for free right now I am worried what will happen when I stop having it, I'm kinda sad about that. I felt like a hideous monster due to my Psoriasis. I am going to have to see if I can find some kind of sponsorship so that I do not have a lapse in treatment because what I am hearing is once you stop it comes back bad. My dermatologist is amazed how fast and clear it has worked  on me.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):It's been five weeks since I started taking Cosentyx and now I am completely clear of psoriasis but I have now begun very very very bad aching bones/joints, very nauseous, my bones have hurt so bad that I'm having so much trouble sleeping. I've gone to the emergency room because of the pain. The ER said everything's fine so I'm gonna continue taking Cosentyx for maybe 2 more months but I'm very scared of what's going on with my body. If my body continues to feel like this will definitely quit.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I found Cosentyx to be very effective. Stubborn lesions on my shins cleared up after a few months which included a weekly loading dose which tapered off to once a month. However , I am very discouraged as I can no longer afford this med as my out of pocket mamimum has almost tripled since last year. So, I had to go off of it.  Much to my chagrin, Medicare patients are not eligible for financial assistance! So my psoriasis is back with a vengeance!

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I've had psoriasis since I was 5 yrs old the moderate to severe form of them. I developed Psoriatic Arthritis on top of my already moderate to severe psoriasis after being abruptly removed from Stelara in 2016 when I was diagnoised with thyroid cancer. After I had the thyroidectomy I developed Psoriatic Arthritis Flare its believed to have been brought on by Endocrinologist abruptly stopping my Stelara injections (most doctors don't understand biologic medication). I started Cosentyx Sept 2018 and I have been 100% clear ever since self injecting is easy peasy 30 minutes on counter top and couple minutes under my arm pit (yup) no pain only mild bruising. I have to say for me Cosentyx has not been a miracle for my psoriatic arthritis flare that has been on going now for 2.5 yrs attacking my tendons and now knees. This disease stinks and has left me house bound alot...awful.  Remember all magic comes with a price!
Cosentyx (secukinumab):Side effects of cosentyx are 50 times worse than actual plaque psoriasis
Cosentyx (secukinumab):Got rid of spots but am having bad sinus infection / meningitis reaction from it - so I'm in hospital
Cosentyx (secukinumab):Cleared up skin 100% But had chest infection. tonsilitis and bad cough.  So not sure if it is causing this I'm normally well.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):This has been a miracle drug for me. I have suffered  psoriasis for 30 years nows. I have tried everything under the sun.  I had been on Stelara and it was working but not clearing all of the plaques. I started my loading dose of 300mg and seen immediate results after 3 days of first dose. I have just administered my third dose today and so thankful to say my plaque psoriasis is 95% cleared. I still two plaques in my scalp but I am willing to bet by my fourth dose they will be cleared. I am one happy patient after 30 years of suffering.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I started my loading dose in September.  I was truly amazed how my psoriasis was clearing.  My skin was smooth for the first time in 20 years.   I started having diarrhea and blood .  I didn’t think anything was wrong at first just thought I ate something that didn’t agree with me.  After a week of diarrhea and more blood I called the doctor, after tests I was informed that I had severe ulcerative colitis.  I am 49 years old and have never had any signs of having colitis or ulcerative colitis.  My doctor was shocked,  how bad it was  I contacted my dermatologist with what was happening and could this be from the Cosentyx. She had me stop taking it immediately.  I then developed eye puffiness and developed a cyst along with fever and sinus issues.  I did some further research and found that many of these issues that I was having are all possible side effects .    I hope that anyone that uses this product reads all the side effects .  I thought side effects  would happen early on.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I had very mild psoriasis, it was mainly on the scalp had 6 or 7 small lesions on different places on my body. I started consentyx 6 weeks ago.  I started with a  loading dose of 150 once a week for the 1st 2 weeks. I didn’t see any progress and I was really frustrated so I decided to increase the dose to 300 once a week after that, within 2 weeks I was 100% free , now I take 300 every month as a maintenance dose and I thank god everyday for this medication.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):After my second loading dose I had an allergic reaction. My face became swollen and I had to go to ER. My lungs felt heavy and was given epipen. I also became nauseous and vomited. While I hope this drug works for others it did not for me!

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I have been on Cosentyx for 16 months and it has cleared about 80% of my plaque psoriasis but for the last 3 months I have had sinus issues that will not go away.  It feels like I have a constant cold and I'm thinking of asking to switch to something else. It doesn't seem to clear the psoriasis on my feet either like Otezla did

Cosentyx (secukinumab):Tried cosentyx and it worked great the first year, complete clear skin, no pain but It stopped working.  Went with Otezla and it’s not working at all.  Thinking of asking doctor to put me back cosentyx again but wonder if it would be effective second try.  Anyone gone back to cosentyx after not using for a while?

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I have had psoriasis for 35 years tried herbal, steroids, quack diets, tablets, different ointments (except daivonex cream) and nothing improved my condition, I have been on Cosentyx for four weeks and my skin is already 75% clear.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):Cosentyx has been the miracle drug!! This was the 1st year in 29 years where I actually wore short sleeves & even shorts. I have psoriasis and psor istic arthritis & last fall both got a lot worse.  I have been on so many topical solutions, creams, prescriptions, pills, biologics, with no luck. Some would ease the pain but never clear the symptoms. I decided to just focus on the sun's help until last fall where nothing worked. I went back to my derm & he wanted to try Cosentyx since it had little side effects & required less follow up testing & at that time it had been out for over a year. No joke, within 2 WEEKS I was completely clear & I still am. I cannot tell you how much this has changed my life. I know psoriaisi isn't a life threatening disease but emotionally it might as well be. The embarrassment, the pain & sometimes just looking at it got me so down. Cosentyx has changed my life. I also haven't had much joint pain. I hope one day I won't have to be on anything but until then Cosentyx is my life.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I started cosentryx 9 weeks ago. It truly is a miracle drug. With the first dose my psoriasis was disappearing. I have lived with psoriasis for 27 years. Now I am happy to be able to actually wear short sleeves and shorts.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I am at week 17 and am 100% clear.  I had a throat infection with high fever for 3 days at week 12, other than that no side effects.  My joints feel tender, but it may be from the reduced swelling making them ‘looser’. Only other drawback is the $$’s for the med.  I am still working to get coverage.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):7 years of severe guttate psoriasis is practically gone after 1 month on Cosentyx.  I've tried creams, UVb lights, diets etc with limited success.  This is truly a miracle drug and has given me my active life back.  Bless the creators of this drug.  I can't recommend enough!

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I was put on consentyx about five weeks ago before that was on remicade.  I had no blood sugar issues until now. Please just for your safety get your blood sugar checked.  I had no issues on remicade  and went for routine physical and blood sugar was 500 mg after fasting should be in 100-112 range.  It can cause big health issues.  They are trying to figure it out now. I’ll keep u posted. I am not bad mouthing the drug because I am grateful they are finding better treatment -  I just think they should look into this.   Search for this  online  and you will see.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I tried all sorts of medications and treatment for couple years  such as UV light, steroid cream, HUMIRA, BUT when my new dermatologist prescribe me COSENTYZ after couple weeks of injections I could see some improvements and continued taking it. Now I'm all healed up

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I have had plaque psoriasis for over 20 years tried otezla, methotrexate creams and lotions. Cosentyx has come to my rescue it has cleared my skin and I feel like a human being. For the first time in years I can wear clothes with short sleeve shirts there's no plaque on my face. I've only started this treatment but it keeps improving my skin all the time. I have never been happier I thought this could never happen and it did clear skin does happen!

Cosentyx (secukinumab):Been on Consentyx for almost a year.  I was about 80% covered before starting and was 100% clear after the loading stage.  But as of Mar 18 it came back with a fury.  I'm now taking shots every 2 weeks to no avail.  Its coming back like it never went away..

Cosentyx (secukinumab):Plaque psoriasis started when I was 22 (13 years ago). Used steroid creams but it got to where it covered so much of my body, it was impossible to treat - so I simply maintained.About 18 months ago, I finally decided to get a dermatologist. We started on Otezla and after about 5 months, there was no more improvement (which was very little).After 1 year of Otezla, asked my derm about Cosentyx. We started that March 2018. After the first month of loading doses, I went from about 60%  of my body clear to 75% clear. After my May dose, I am now almost 100% clear. It did leave behind discolored areas of skin where the larger plaques were but that is slowly fading away with tanning and continued Cosentyx injections.Easy injectable pens and little to no side effects. Definitely worth considering.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I have had psoriasis since I was about six months old, having to lay on a towel from being unable to wear diapers, breaking out in horrible burning rashes from almost anything scented. Years of being subjected to laser therapies, tar shampoos and soaps, oatmeal baths( oatmeal EVERYTHING....don't even get me started on aveeno), all it does is smell good. I have tried vitamins, light therapy, other shots, medications, and nothing would get rid of the growing scaly red flaky patches on my scalp, forehead, ears, and elbows. Side effects I had itching for a few days, bruising from site injections, dizzy for about 30 minuted after dose, but otherwise no complaints. This is a specialty drug. It has to be refrigerated and you have to take two shots once a month, self inject or have a family member do it but they are sensory pens so not too hard or complicated.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I started injections on Friday.  I've got psoriasis all over body at moment. I took injection out fridge  did not inject till room temp but it still stung and burnt.  Can anyone help on what to do for comfy injection please :)

Cosentyx (secukinumab):After 14 years on other biologics with minimal results and loads of side effects. Cosentyx has changed my life in just 4 months!! For the first time in almost 20 years I have clear skin and wore a short sleeve shirt in public. What an amazing feeling!

Cosentyx (secukinumab):It’s an amazing medicine. I’ve tried so many treatments for my psoriasis and they would work only at the beginning, I’ve tried the ointments, the UV lights, the pills and nothing was really good enough for me, plus they had  bad side effects. But since I’ve started  cosentyx my life got much better , I’m 99% cleared from psoriasis, with only small side effect ( running nose ) which I consider is nothing comparing to previous treatments .. I’m so happy now I feel like I’m a new person just started living my life.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I've had psoriasis for over 35 years last year it came on really bad like never before my first treatment was humira which I  had a bad reaction so I stopped taking it.  Then  I went on Otezla for 8 months with no result then my doctor put me on cosentyx and I'm so grateful because in less then a month I've had such great result compared to 8 months of nothing this is such a miracle drug with no side effects. I'm one satisfied customer thank you.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I have Palmoplantar Pustular Psoriatic Arthritis, and since it is severe) I get treated w/ones meant for plaque psoriasis. After 7 months of Cosentyx, no change. In fact, flares happened 99% of the time immediately after injection. Disappointing.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I tried this medication while waiting for my insurance to approve tremfya it was a joke. No change of psoriasis and gave me athletes foot as a side effect. I suggest humira over cosentyx any day
Cosentyx (secukinumab):It is the worst

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I have had Psoriasis for over 20 years and tried UVB and other medications. None of them is working until Cosentyx was approved. I got clean skin in loaded period. It worked as miracle.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I have just finished the loading phase and feel that I do have less pain but I feel itchy on my hips yet have no psoriasis there though just itchy skin. I am a diabetic and my blood sugar has become very high and I am having a heck of a time trying to bring it down, I use insulin, I keep taking higher and higher doses of insulin but I am not there yet. This is a worry as diabetes is a gateway disease for so many other diseases. Also, having a lot of pain around my ankles, not sure it is connected also having a creepy crawlies on my face that is annoying. Don't see my Rheumatologist until the end of January to ask him about this stuff.
Cosentyx (secukinumab):Absolutely destroyed the psoriasis.  I sometimes forget I have it & forget to re-order...  boom! $70mo

Cosentyx (secukinumab):Completed 10 shots - the loading phase.  Now into the 1 shot per month maintenance phase.  But I’ve noticed little improvement to maintain.    What I have noticed is that the scaling has stopped, replaced by dark - almost gray - Itchy bumpy skin where the P is, surrounded by itchy bumpy normal colored skin.   Also since I’ve started the drug, I have itchy spots all over - even in places I never had P and still don’t have P.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):7 year sufferer, 2 1/2 years on UVB and laser therapy. I've only taken 2 shot and I'm noticing a huge difference already.  My hands no longer look like I was in a fire and one leg is almost totally clear. So far, no side effects.  I had instant side effects with Otezla-from the first dose.  I'm giving this an 9 only because of the insurance issue.  Even thou they approved Otezla, I'm having a hard time getting Cosentyx approved.Hoping this is my miracle cure.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I suffered with plaque and even worse painful inverse psoriasis for over 40 years.  Through the years I've tried every prescription from ointments, sprays and pills all with mixed results.  I started on Cosentyx after 3 weeks the inverse psoriasis was completely clear and 6 weeks the plaques were gone  9 weeks I am completely clear head to toe.  My 40 year battle is over.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I have psoriasis and I did not have PSA but my doctor said it was time to start something else because creams and ointments were no longer working. I have good insurance and my doctor started me on Cosentyx samples to start, Novartis was sending me samples at no charge said they would work with my insurance to get it approved, no problem they said if your insurance doesn't cover it you will be covered through us for 2 years. Go ahead and start they said, now that my insurance has declined it twice they want me to sign away all of my Federal Privacy Laws pertaining to my private health information or they will not send me anymore samples. I have 10 biologic shots in me at this time- how do you switch now?!
Not happy. After 5 injections of 300mg, only 20% cleared. Still with Redness and thickness. Itching reduced somewhat.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):Very impressed.  After four injections my psoriasis is very close to being gone.  Still some scarring but itching has stopped.  I generally feel much better physically and emotionally.
Cosentyx (secukinumab):Heartbroken

Cosentyx (secukinumab):@ Thomas Sakowych RE:your comment on Cosentyx use for psoriasis. You stated on 10/31/15 that you had lost your big toe due to osteomyelitis infection. How is that related to the Consentyx? I have toe and nail psoriasis really bad and am beginning Cosentyx. Thank you

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I've been on 300 mg shots once a week for six weeks. My plaques are a little thinner but no clearance. I'm also on a topical and mexotrexate. Humira and embrel didn't work either. I'm sad because I got my hopes up 2 years ago when I sought treatment.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I have been on Cosentyx for 1 year.  I view it as a miracle drug.  Best yet.   Most everything cleared up.   I know have some coming back on my lower legs which is depressing because I would like to be in shorts all the time.     I recently just had an infection in my leg that may have been related.   I met with my doctor and I have decided to try Taltz for total clearance.    Taltz reviews are an 8 while reviews here are a 9.2.   I hope I made the right choice.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I'm thrilled with Cosentyx!! My doctor made me try the other one, Taltz, and I got horrible injection site reactions from it. Cosentyx started clearing my skin after the first injection and by a month, I was almost clear for the first time in years! Swimsuit here I come!! Oh and their plan brings my copay to zero and it's not based on my income. Did I say I love this medicine??

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I have had psoriasis for 30 years. I've used many topical ointments, light therapy, and Embrel. I've also tried many home remedies and recommendations; however, nothing worked to clear my skin and my arthritis got worse. I started Cosentyx and after 3 weekly shots, my skin started clearing, by my second monthly shot, my skin was completely cleared everywhere! My arthritis is already much better after the 3rd monthly shot and hardly noticeable at all. If you are a candidate, I highly recommend this course of therapy. The shots are barely painful (I am a wimp).

I started this product as a clinical patient and have very happy with the results. Before starting this program my legs were red sore and flaking so bad that I didn't even like to wear shorts because of the staring I got from people. It has been 6 years now and I now have one little spot on my shin but I can live with that.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I have suffered with this debilitating and embarrassing disease for more than  10 years.  Creams, steroids and light therapy made no difference.  I am on week 5 of Cosentyx and experienced a severe cold and cough that I could not fight due to the weekend immune system.  Other than  that this is proving to be a miracle for me.  Almost clear! I cannot remember the last time my skin felt soft and itch free. No more flaky scalp and body! I am hoping that the great results continue and wish the best to all other users!

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I just took my injection yesterday and I'm already seeing some improvement so by the mid-month I should be clear I'm feeling very hopeful I've been dealing with this over 20 years I was on Humira but as most of us know your body gets immune it did work I was on it for maybe over 5 years it did clear it up but for the last couple years my body has resisted it.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I thought that Cosentyx was finally the miracle drug as it cleared me about 100% for a good two years. But now all of a sudden it's starting to flare up on my lower legs out of nowhere...man this is BS.I guess I should be thankful for the couple clear years I had in my life. Back to Earth again I guess. Hopefully the next 2-year miracle drug comes soon.I bet the cure for psoriasis is out there, just like the cure for cancer probably is...but big pharma wouldn't allow that to happen...nope too much money to lose.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):Over 20 year sufferer covering a huge percentage of my body. This was the first medication to EVER clear it completely. I know it doesn't work for everybody. Truly a miracle drug and so thankful to have found it.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):Out of nowhere, in my 50s, I developed Plaque psoriasis.  The local dermatologists did not seem to know how to help me. I was put on heavy steroids and other medicines that made my life miserable. Muscle aches, unable to sleep and rashes that bled up at the merest touch.  I found a specialist in New York City and she is my angel!   I was put on Sterela  which helped. Then I was then switched over to Cosentyx  and my life changed.  I am almost 100% cured, as long as I keep taking the injections.   The side affects that I've noticed are more frequent cold sores and a stuffy nose. I take Valtrex at the same time I take the injection in the cold sores have stopped. The stuffy nose, I can deal with.  This product is a miracle.

I went on Costentyx after a miscommunication with the amount of time I needed to be off Embril, I started my 5 week  dose and continued for 6 months, in that time my psoriasis was completely clear but the side effects were horrendous, hives hotspots breakouts of psoriasis on arms and legs exczema on my hands and feet. The two weeks following my injections I would itch and breakout in hives.  The customer support was non existent I managed to find more information from the US support. I fianally went off it in October 2015 and still dealt with the side effects exczema and some itching. I have spoke to the nurse and was not impress with their knowledge of the drug, Embril had a much better support line!

Cosentyx (secukinumab):Had psoriasis most of my life starting as a teenager. Tried many things before cosentyx inclding Enbrel and Stelara. After 15 long years of nothing working for me Cosentyx has cleared my body by at least 95%. Very easy to use and thankfully NO side affects at all !!!

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I have been on Enbrel, Humira, Otezla and Stelara and various topicals over the past 15 years or so.  Each medication seemed to reach a plateau as far as effectiveness which is why I moved on to another.  I've been on Cosentyx a little less than 2 months and my psoriasis is worse than it's ever been.  I spoke with my dermatologist and was told that Cosentyx seems to take a bit of time to see positive results.  Their experience has been that right around the third month, improvement is seen.  That's the only reason I am staying with it for another month or two.  After reading all these glowing comments about having clearer skin in weeks or a month, I'm a little discouraged that my psoriasis has gone 1000% in the other direction.

Cosentyx (secukinumab):Been living with psoriasis for over 20 years. Tried everything from pills to ointments, it help a little but nothing like cosentyx. I am still in the early stages, just finished my weekly shots and I already see a huge improvement. The itch is completely gone and I can see the redness is clearing on a daily bases. Even my arm hair over the plaque has started growing again. I am thankful that I have insurance as I hear it is quite expensive ..10k per dose....I strongly recommend this treatment, it might change your life, it did for me..

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I have been taking this medication with the study for over 2 years for severe psoriatic arthritis. My psoriasis has disappeared. I rarely have outbreaks and if I do they are small and disappear within weeks. For psoriatic arthritis, I would rate it lower, around a 7, because I still have to take a d-mard each month along with 300 MG monthly of  cosentyx . Still, this is an impressive medication for people with severe psoriasis arthritis. I was barely walking when I started this study and now people ask why I have a handicapped tag. That massive improvement is due, in part, to this medication. It took about 3 months to feel the total effects for the arthritis and there was a noticeable difference taking 300 MG instead of 150 mg.
username: Too Young to feel so old

review: Cosentyx (secukinumab):I have been on Cosentyx for about 3 and a half weeks now and my psoriasis has improved I would say by 80%!!!  All the plaque is now flat against my skin (meaning, if I close my eyes and rub my arm, I cannot feel any areas of plaque).  All that remains is the discoloration from the plaques which are slowly fading as well because I go to the tanning booth to tan.I have experienced NO side effects at all, in fact the skin on my face is also glowing and radiant.  After suffering from psoriasis for over 10 years my body had become immune to Clobetesol and Humaira really didn't work for me, but Cosentyx has been GOD SENT!I would recommend and hope that this work for anyone and the best thing for me has been the quick improvement >30 days!

Cosentyx (secukinumab):Just started cosentyx-  90 per cent of my body covered have used humira,stellara, otezela and multiple creams without much success 4 days after loading dose my hands were 74 per cent better- I'm excited to say this is s great choice w little side effects

Cosentyx (secukinumab):First, let me say that i am so thankful for biologics to treat psoriasis and make possible to live and enjoy life without scales covering 100 percent of my body. I tried stelara and humira but didnt work for me.Thank God for Cosentyx. After the loading doses and first month there after, I am about 98 percent clear. Cosentyx (secukinumab):Freaking miracle drug. I tried everything but nothing would get rid of my psoriasis. I am a 6 year sufferer of it, had it everywhere including my scalp. I am now 6 weeks on Cosentyx and I am completely clear! I am beyond ecstatic, truly incredible stuff. So far I have had so side effects and hopefully that will continue.!

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I have been on Cosentyx now for 5 months. I went from severe to 95% clear, with no side effects so far.Zero sugar, low carb, high fat diet; exercise; and sun/UV on the rash are also very important to keep it clear.Also the plaques have largely to do with a biofilm, sticky fungus bacteria environment, created by normal/harmless skin Malassezia and Staphylococcus varieties. Your body can't break down the biofilm but these can: chitinase, essential oils (thyme oil, rosemary oil, eucalyptus oil, etc.), sugar alcohols (xylitol etc.). I make lotions with these and fractionated coconut oil (which are anti-Malassezia saturated fat chains) to break down the psoriasis plaques so they can heal. Active vitamin D prescription ointment (calcitriol).

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I have had psoriasis for 20 years,  on my scalp and body.  I have tried every cream,  ointment,  pill and quite a few shots. So when my doctor suggested trying Cosentyx,  I wasn't exactly thrilled to have to give myself shots again. But I tried it and after just the first month I could finally see my knees, I didn't have to apply and creams, ointments or scalp oils. Every last bit of my psoriasis was cleared, 100%, I couldn't believe my eyes , I  was amazed!!!! 20 years of putting on scalp oil, with a shower cap on and going to bed embarrassed next to my husband, and now I can get out of the shower, style my hair and go,  NO MORE SHOWER CAPS!!  I know every medicine works differently for every person,  but you have to give it a try!

Cosentyx (secukinumab):I started using Cosentyx in September 2015 I was very apprehensive about trying it but I gave it a try 5 doses for 5wks straight then once every twenty eight day but by the third dose my psoriasis was 98% gone and by my fifth and last dose I'm psoriasis was 100% gone. I have not had any breakouts I am still 100% clear my skin is soft an beautiful I HAD psoriasis for over 30 years I recommend everyone to try COSENTYX I AM very happy I gave this a try an you will be to..
